did.unittitle: Carl Theodore Schwarze Radio Forum Collection
did.abstract: Carl Theodore Schwarze was a Professor of Civil Engineering at New York University (NYU). Materials in this collection primarily include original and photocopied published transcripts of Professor Schwarze's interviews on WMCA New York's "Mid-Week Forum Hour" between 1936 and 1939.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were transferred, date unknown; there is no other documentation concerning the provenance of these materials. The accession number associated with this collection is 2019.004.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged chronologically by subject.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carl Theodore Schwarze was a Professor of Civil Engineering at New York University (NYU). In the 1930s, Schwarze was a guest on WNYC's radio program, "Mid-Week Forum Hour," where he discussed topics related to Christian Science with the host, Erling C. Olsen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include original and photocopied published transcripts of Professor Schwarze's interviews on WMCA New York's "Mid-Week Forum Hour" between 1936 and 1939, and one typed letter composed in French and addressed to a "Proffeseur F.F. Fales." The transcripts are related to topics on Christian Science. Common themes include evolution, Adam and Eve, the end of the world, religion, and human intellect. Topics of note include unicorns, geology, and vitamins and hormones.
